title: Calories in Tomato Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in tomato soup per cup, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Canned tomato soup, prepared with equal volume water, 1 cup serving (245 g); standard commercial variety without added cream.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, preparation method (e.g., with milk vs. water), and portion size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One cup of prepared tomato soup provides about 85 kcal, with high sodium content.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Prepared with milk instead of water
Homemade with fresh tomatoes (no added salt)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of tomato soup?
faqs.a: About 85 kcal for canned tomato soup prepared with water.

faqs.q: Is tomato soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one cup has around 759 mg sodium; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce intake.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in tomato soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 18 g carbs per cup, mostly from natural tomato sugars.
Creamy versions (with milk or cream) add 40–60 kcal per cup, totaling 125–145 kcal.
Yes, about 1.9 g dietary fiber per cup from tomatoes and vegetables.
